summary: Jland Group, Damansara Holdings Berhad, Zaquin Resources, and an investor have formed a strategic partnership to enhance waste management solutions. The joint venture, Jlg Zaquin Sdn Bhd Jlgz, will focus on smart waste management solutions, leveraging technology and data to enhance efficiency and sustainability within the waste industry. The partnership was signed deputy chairman of Jlg Group, and Damansara Holdings Berhad. The partnership is expected to expand to other states in the near future.

Scammers are rehashing the old con with a new twist, known as "pig butchering," which combines love scams with sophisticated financial fraud involving crypto currency and investment schemes. Between 2022 and June 2024, 52 people have fallen victim to the scam, losing more than RMB5 million in total. Police are seeing an uptick in pigbutchering scams in southeast Asia.

The past few days have seen a number of incidents in Pulau Pinang and it is not the first time the town has seen a number of incidents. Police are currently searching for a white Perodua Myvi driver who was driving recklessly leading to an accident involving two cars at km 93 on the Ipoh Butterworth Road. A viral video uploaded on Facebook showed the driver driving recklessly, leading to the accident. Police have filed two police reports and recorded conversations as part of their investigation. Preliminary investigations reveal the owner of the Perodua Myvi is a 45-year-old Indian woman. The case is classified under section 42 1 of the Road Transport Act 1987. A seminar on the importance of sleep took place at Ak Academy on July 11, 2024, with guest speakers. Sleep is essential for maintaining physical health, mental clarity, emotional balance, overall wellbeing, strengthening the immune system, improving cognitive function, and enhancing mood and productivity. Zero waste management is the future for Malaysia, and it is essential to reject outdated methods like incinerators and waste to energy. These methods are expensive, ineffective, and harmful to the environment. Domestic waste is wet and unsuitable for electricity production. The Le Tour de Langkawi, a multiple-stage bicycle race in Malaysia, began on September 29 in Langkawi Island, Keselahat. The race, named after the archipelago, has been held annually since 1996, primarily in February. The race consists of 10 days of segments, but has been reduced to eight stages over recent years. The Genting Highlands climb is always included. The race has been a major event in Malaysia, with the Padang Besar International Shuttle Train special no 947 departing from Hat Yai Junction at 855am.
